div.p: Schematic of major processes contributing to Arctic surface warming in the NP-Warm and NA-Warm simulations. Enhanced ocean heat flux increases the water vapor and latent heat transport into the Arctic, stimulating sea-ice retreat and an increase in low-cloud formation. The reported values are the mean anomalies integrated for the Arctic regionÂ for the NP-Warm simulation ( a) and NA-Warm simulation ( b)
